noun.description: Threads of silk, cotton, or other material woven into a decorative band for edging or trimming garments.
examples: a coat trimmed with gold braid

noun.description: A length of hair made up of three or more interlaced strands.

verb.description: Interlace three or more strands of (hair or other flexible material) to form a length.
examples: their long hair was tightly braided

verb.description: Edge or trim (a garment) with braid.
(of a river or stream) flow into shallow interwoven channels divided by deposits of sediment.

origin: Old English bregdan make a sudden movement, also interweave, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch breien (verb).
